intro: Bonnaya brachycarpa, commonly known as the narrow-fruited bonnaya, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its small, palmate leaves and clusters of yellowish-white flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that remains closed until maturity, releasing seeds through a specialized mechanism. Bonnaya brachycarpa is often found in moist, shaded habitats within tropical forests.
